{{Infobox TV channel | name = Jetix Scandinavia | logofile = | logosize = | logoalt = | logo2 = | launch = April 1998 | closed date = September 2009 | picture format = | share = 0.1% | share as of = Sweden 2008 | share source = {{Cite document|url=http://mms.se/_dokument/rapporter/ar/%C3%85rsrapport%202008.pdf|publisher=MediamÃ¤tning i Skandinavien|title=Ãrsrapport 2008}} | network = | owner = [[Disney-ABC Television Group]] | slogan = | country = [[United Kingdom]] | broadcast area = [[Nordic countries]] | headquarters = | former names = Fox Kids Scandinavia | replaced by names= [[Disney XD Scandinavia|Disney XD]] | sister names = | timeshift names = | web = [http://www.jetix.se/ jetix.se]
[http://www.jetix.dk/ jetix.dk]
[http://www.jetix.no/ jetix.no]
[http://www.jetix.fi/ jetix.fi] | terr serv 1 = | terr chan 1 = | sat serv 1 = [[Canal Digital]] | sat chan 1 = | sat serv 2 = [[Viasat]] | sat chan 2 = | cable serv 1 = [[Com Hem]] | cable chan 1 = | cable serv 2 = [[TDC Kabel TV]] | cable chan 2 = | cable serv 3 = [[Canal Digital]] | cable chan 3 = | cable serv 4 = [[Tele2Vision]] | cable chan 4 = | cable serv 5 = | cable chan 5 = | sat radio serv 1 = | sat radio chan 1 = | adsl serv 1 = | adsl chan 1 = | online serv 1 = | online chan 1 = }} {{Unreferenced|date=December 2008}}'''Jetix Scandinavia''' was a television channel owned by [[Disney-ABC Television Group]] targeting children broadcasting to the Nordic countries. It was launched in 1998 and was then known as '''Fox Kids''', but it was rebranded in 2004 since [[Saban Entertainment]] and [[News Corporation]] had sold all Fox Kids channels to Disney. The Scandinavian version of Jetix available in [[Sweden]], [[Norway]], [[Denmark]] and [[Finland]] was replaced by [[Disney XD Scandinavia|Disney XD]] on September 11, 2009. On satellite, the channel was initially only available on the [[Canal Digital]] platform. It launched on the [[Viasat]] platform in 2005. It was also available on most cable networks in the region. The channel broadcasted between 06:00 and 18:00 and carried audio in four languages: [[Swedish language|Swedish]], [[Norwegian language|Norwegian]], [[Finnish language|Finnish]] and [[Danish language|Danish]]. Jetix received a license to broadcast terrestrially in Sweden in March 2008, but was never able to use it. This was because transmission company [[Teracom]] decided to freeze its investment in the network where Jetix would have broadcast, because of a disagreement with the [[Post and Telecom Agency (Sweden)|Post and Telecom Agency]] over transmission fees. ==Disney XD rebrand== The Scandinavian version of Jetix available in [[Sweden]], [[Norway]], [[Denmark]] and [[Finland]] was replaced by Disney XD, on September 12, 2009. When [[Disney XD]] successfully launched on February 13, 2009, in the US, [[Disney XD]] was rolled out to France on April 1, 2009 and was rolled out to other European territories in 2009. {{cite web |url=http://www.broadbandtvnews.com/?p=14241 |title=French Jetix becomes Disney XD |publisher=Broadband TV News |date=2009-02-16 }} {{cite web |url=http://www.c21media.net/resources/detail.asp?area=79&article=47666 |title=Jetix France rebrands as Disney XD |publisher=[[C21 Media]] |date=2009-02-17 }} . ==Shows Aired On Jetix In Scandinavia== *''[[A.T.O.M.]]'' *''[[Black Hole High]]'' *''[[Captain Flamingo]]'' *''[[Galactic Football]]'' *''[[H2O: Just Add Water]]'' *''[[Martin Mystery]]'' *''[[Oban Star-Racers]]'' *''[[Planet Sketch]]'' *''[[PokÃ©mon (anime)|PokÃ©mon]] *''[[The Buzz On Maggie]]'' *''[[Lloyd in Space]]'' *''[[Power Rangers: Mystic Force]]'' *''[[Pucca (TV series)|Pucca]]'' *''[[Recess (TV series)|Recess]]'' *''[[Shuriken School]]'' *''[[Sonic X]]'' *''[[Spider-Man (1994 TV series)|Spider-Man]]'' *''[[Super Robot Monkey Team Hyperforce Go!]]'' *''[[Team Galaxy]]'' *''[[Tiny Planets]]'' *''[[Tutenstein]]'' *''[[W.I.T.C.H.
